cyclone.name: ALEX
cyclone.current_location: about 125 mi north of Cozumel, Mexico and 420 mi southwest of Ft. Myers, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northeast across the southeastern Gulf, forecast to cross the southern-central Florida Peninsula Saturday and emerge into the western Atlantic north of the north-western Bahamas Sunday, then continue ENE toward open Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Gulf coast of the Florida Peninsula (near Naples / Ft. Myers area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A (no watch area along Florida east coast at this time)
weather_observation.warning_coast: East coast of Florida south of the Volusia/Brevard County line to Card Sound Bridge, including the Florida Keys and Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southern and central Florida Peninsula, Keys, portions of Gulf and Atlantic coasts, and north-western Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible Saturday afternoon through late Saturday night around Port Canaveral; cumulative chance 18% for ≥34 kt.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Little to no surge impact expected along the east-central Florida coast; any rise likely below 3 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could bring 4–8 inches with localized higher totals, creating flash and urban flooding risks around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes/waterspouts possible in outer rain bands; rough seas and short-period swells will affect channel approaches, disrupting pilotage and cargo operations.
